This method is called to update the drop down bars to match the current contents of the text editor window. It is called during OnIdle when the caret position changes. You can provide new drop down members here. It is up to you to sort the ArrayLists if you want them sorted in any particular order.
member.param: The language service
The editor window
The line on which the cursor is now positioned
The column on which the cursor is now position
The current list of types (you can update this)
The current list of members (you can update this)
The selected type (you can update this)
The selected member (you can update this)
member.returns: true if something was updated

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditSpan
member.summary: This class encapsulates one atomic edit operation. Add these to an EditArray then when you are ready call ApplyEdits().

The text to insert in it's place (can be null)

member.summary: Returns the number of lines in the new text being inserted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditSpan.LengthOfLastLine
member.summary: Returns the length of the last line of text being inserted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditArray
member.summary: This class encapsulates a batch edit operation. The reason this class exists is because performing thousands of tiny edits on a large document can be pretty slow, so the best thing to do is merge the edits into bigger chunks and that is exactly what this class will do for you. The trick is that when merging edits you need to be careful not to include any IVsTextLineMarkers in the merged chunks, because editing over the top of the marker will blow it away, which is not what the user wants. The user wants to keep all their breakpoints and bookmarks, and red and blue squigglies and so on. So this class also takes care of that.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditArray.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ISource,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextView,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: This constructor takes a view and will use CompoundViewAction to make the updates and it will update the current selection accordingly. The buffer to operate on The text view to use for CompoundViewAction and whose selection you want updated Whether to attempt to merge edits Name used in compound action

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditArray.Count
member.summary: Return the number of edits in the array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditArray.Add(Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditSpan)
member.summary: Add a new atomic edit to the array. The edits cannot intersect each other. The spans in each edit must be based on the current state of the buffer, and not based on post-edit spans. This EditArray will calculate the post edit spans for you.

member.summary: You must construct this object with an ExpansionProvider

member.summary: Override this method if you want intellisense drop support on a list of possible values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ExpansionFunction.GetArgument(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified argument, resolving any fields referenced in the argument. In the substitution, "$$" is replaced with "$" and any floating '$' signs are left unchanged, for example "$US 23.45" is returned as is. Only if the two dollar signs enclose a string of letters or digits is this considered a field name (e.g. "$foo123$"). If the field is not found then the unresolved string "$foo" is returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ILanguageServiceTestHelper

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.BackgroundRequestReason.ParseFile
member.summary: This reason is used when we want to trigger only 'parsing' (without type-checking) to update the untyped AST information (e.g. when a different file is opened). After updating the untyped scope (in F# LS), a 'null' can be returned as the result of 'ExecuteBackgroundRequest'.

If this returns true we can reuse a recent IntellisenseInfo if its available

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.LanguageService_DEPRECATED.LastActiveTextView
member.devdoc: Returns the last active IVsTextView that is managed by this language service.

members.member: Returns the last active successful fetch of an IntellisenseInfo that is managed by this language service. This is only relevant to the active text view and is cleared each time the text view is switched. If it is null we must make a background request to the language service to get the recent full typecheck results. If a file is dirty, an OnIdle call will kick in to refresh the recent results.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.PendingRequests_DEPRECATED
member.summary: Stores incoming requests Maintains queue using following rules 1. Max amount of items in queue = 2 2. requests are divided to UI and non-UI 3. UI request discards all requests that were enqueued before 4. non-UI request replaces old non-UI request that was enqueued before 5. if non-UI request is enqueued after UI request -> nothing happens and they will be dequeued subsequently

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.PendingRequests_DEPRECATED.ContainsSimilarRequest(Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.BackgroundRequest_DEPRECATED)
member.summary: Checks if request queue contains request similar to the given one.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.PendingRequests_DEPRECATED.Dequeue
member.summary: Gets request from queue

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.PendingRequests_DEPRECATED.Set(Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.BackgroundRequest_DEPRECATED)
member.summary: Discards all requests added so far and enqueues specified request.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink
member.summary: AuthoringSink is used to gather information from the parser to help in the following: - error reporting - matching braces (ctrl-]) - intellisense: Member Selection, CompleteWord, QuickInfo, MethodTips - management of the autos window in the debugger - breakpoint validation

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink.BraceMatching
member.summary: Use this property to find if your parser should call MatchPair or MatchTriple

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink.MatchPair(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Whenever a matching pair is parsed, e.g. '{' and '}', this method is called with the text span of both the left and right item. The information is used when a user types "ctrl-]" in VS to find a matching brace and when auto-highlight matching braces is enabled. A priority can also be given so that multiple overlapping pairs can be prioritized for brace matching. The matching pair with the highest priority (largest integer value) wins.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink.MatchTriple(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Matching tripples are used to highlight in bold a completed statement. For example when you type the closing brace on a foreach statement VS highlights in bold the statement that was closed. The first two source contexts are the beginning and ending of the statement that opens the block (for example, the span of the "foreach(...){" and the third source context is the closing brace for the block (e.g., the "}"). A priority can also be given so that multiple overlapping pairs can be prioritized for brace matching. The matching pair with the highest priority (largest integer value) wins.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink.AutoExpression(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: AutoExpression is in support of IVsLanguageDebugInfo.GetProximityExpressions. It is called for each expression that might be interesting for a user in the "Auto Debugging" window. All names that are set using StartName and QualifyName are already automatically added to the "Auto" window! This means that AutoExpression is rarely used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink.CodeSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: CodeSpan is in support of IVsLanguageDebugInfo.ValidateBreakpointLocation. It is called for each region that contains "executable" code. This is used to validate breakpoints. Comments are automatically taken care of based on TokenInfo returned from scanner. Normally this method is called when a procedure is started/ended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AuthoringSink.AddError(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.Severity)
member.summary: Add an error message. This method also filters out duplicates so you only see the unique errors in the error list window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.OLECMDTEXT.GetText(System.IntPtr)
member.devdoc: Accessing the text of this structure is very cumbersome. Instead, you may use this method to access an integer pointer of the structure. Passing integer versions of this structure is needed because there is no way to tell the common language runtime that there is extra data at the end of the structure.

member.devdoc: Accessing the text of this structure is very cumbersome. Instead, you may use this method to access an integer pointer of the structure. Passing integer versions of this structure is needed because there is no way to tell the common language runtime that there is extra data at the end of the structure.
member.summary: Sets the text inside the structure starting from an integer pointer.
member.param: The integer pointer to the position where to set the text.
The text to set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.GetAbsolutePath(System.String)
member.devdoc: This method takes a file URL and converts it to an absolute path. The trick here is that if there is a '#' in the path, everything after this is treated as a fragment. So we need to append the fragment to the end of the path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.GetLocalPath(System.String)
member.devdoc: This method takes a file URL and converts it to a local path. The trick here is that if there is a '#' in the path, everything after this is treated as a fragment. So we need to append the fragment to the end of the path.

Specifies additional message-specific information.
Specifies additional message-specific information.

member.returns: A handle to the previous parent window indicates success. NULL indicates failure.

Handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the z-order.
Specifies the new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
Specifies the new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
Specifies the new width of the window, in pixels.
Specifies the new height of the window, in pixels.
Specifies the window sizing and positioning flags.

member.summary: Decrements the lock count associated with a memory object.

member.returns: If the memory object is still locked after decrementing the lock count, the return value is a nonzero value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.GlobalFree(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Frees the specified global memory object and invalidates its handle.
member.param: Handle to the global memory object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NULL; if it fails the return value is equal to a handle to the global memory object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.GlobalSize(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Retrieves the current size of the specified global memory object, in bytes.
member.param: Handle to the global memory object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the size of the specified global memory object, in bytes; it is zero otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.WideCharToMultiByte(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Maps a wide-character string to a new character string. The new character string is not necessarily from a multibyte character set.
member.param: Specifies the code page used to perform the conversion.
Specifies the handling of unmapped characters.
The wide-character string to be converted.
The number of wide characters in the string pointed to by the wideStr parameter.
Points to the buffer to receive the translated string.
the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pOutBytes parameter.
The character used if a wide character cannot be represented in the specified code page.
Flag that indicates whether a default character was used.
member.returns: If the function succeeded, the return value is the number of bytes written to the buffer pointed to by pOutBytes; zero otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.NativeMethods.IsSameComObject(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Compares two COM objects to see if they represent the same underlying object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.LanguagePreferences
M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.LanguagePreferences.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider,System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the language preferences.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.LanguagePreferences.Site
member.summary: This property is not public for a reason. If it were public it would get called during LoadSettingsFromStorage which will break it. Instead use GetSite().

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.TokenInfo.Token
member.summary: Language Specific

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.TokenTriggers
member.summary:
TokenTriggers: If a character has (a) trigger(s) associated with it, it may fire one or both of the following triggers: MemberSelect - a member selection tip window MatchBraces - highlight matching braces or the following trigger: MethodTip - a method tip window
The following triggers exist for speed reasons: the (fast) lexer determines when a (slow) parse might be needed. The Trigger.MethodTip trigger is subdivided in 4 other triggers. It is the best to be as specific as possible; it is better to return Trigger.ParamStart than Trigger.Param (or Trigger.MethodTip)

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED
member.summary: Source represents one source file and manages the parsing and intellisense on this file and keeping things like the drop down combos in sync with the source and so on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.IsCompletorActive
member.devdiv: returns true if either CompletionSet or MethodData is being displayed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.ReformatSpan(Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.EditArray,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan)
member.summary: This method formats the given span using the given EditArray. The default behavior does nothing. So you need to override this method if you want formatting to work. An empty input span means reformat the entire document. You also need to turn on Preferences.EnableFormatSelection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.GetCommentFormat
member.summary: Implement this method to provide different comment delimiters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.CommentLines(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.String)
member.summary: Called from Comment Selection. Default behavior is to insert line style comments at beginning and end of selection. Override to add custome behavior.
member.returns: The final span of the commented lines including the comment delimiters

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.CommentBlock(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called from Comment Selection. Default behavior is to insert block style comments at beginning and end of selection. Override to add custome behavior.
member.returns: The final span of the commented block including the comment delimiters

member.summary: Uncomments the given span of text and returns the span of the uncommented block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.UncommentBlock(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Uncomments the given block and returns the span of the uncommented block

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.ScanToNonWhitespaceChar(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the column position of 1st non whitespace character on line

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.ColumnToVisiblePosition(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the column position that the user will see given the current tab size setting. This is the opposite of VisiblePositionToColumn

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.VisiblePositionToColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert a user visible position back to char position in the buffer. This is the opposite of ColumnToVisiblePosition. In this case the visible position was off the end of the line, it just returns the column position at the end of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.NormalizeErrorString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns normalized form of given string replacing all control chars.

members.member: Converts --flaterrors messages back to messages with embedded newlines

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FSharpSourceBase_DEPRECATED.CheckForRename
member.summary: If the file has been renamed then do some cleanup.

members.member: Trim whitespace from the beginning and ending of the given span.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.CompoundAction
member.summary: This class can be used in a using statement to open and close a compound edit action via IVsCompoundAction interface. Be sure to call Close() at the end of your using statement, otherwise Dispose will call Abort.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.CompoundViewAction
member.summary: This class can be used in a using statement to open and close a compound edit action via IVsCompoundAction interface from an IVsTextView. This allows the view to optimize it's updates based on edits you are making on the buffer, so it's the preferred way of doing things if you have access to the IVsTextView. If not, use CompoundAction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.CompoundViewAction.Dispose
member.summary: This method calls Close if you have not already called Close

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.FilePathUtilities.GetFileExtension(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns the file extension in lower case, including the "." and trims any blanks or null characters from the string. Null's can creep in via interop if we get a badly formed BSTR

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AbstractPatternMatcher.caseSensitive
member.summary: Whether case-sensitive matches are preferred. When set to true, this means that case-sensitive matches may be prefered over a case insensitive one. For example, if the candidate matches the pattern exactly but case insensitively, it will still lose to a case-sensitive camel-case match.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AbstractPatternMatcher.MatchSingleWordPattern(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a candidate string should matched given the user's pattern.
member.param: The string to test.
The pattern to match against, which may use things like Camel-Cased patterns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AbstractPatternMatcher.BreakIntoCharacterParts(System.String)
member.summary: Breaks an identifier string into constituent parts. Do not call. Internal only for testing purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.AbstractPatternMatcher.BreakIntoWordParts(System.String)
member.summary: Breaks an identifier string into constituent parts. Do not call. Internal only for testing purposes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter
member.summary:
ViewFilter provides a default implementation of IVsTextViewFilter providing a handling of the following VS commands:
VsCommands.GotoDefn VsCommands.GotoDecl VsCommands.GotoRef VsCommands2K.COMMENT_BLOCK VsCommands2K.UNCOMMENT_BLOCK VsCommands2K.SHOWMEMBERLIST VsCommands2K.COMPLETEWORD VsCommands2K.PARAMINFO VsCommands2K.QUICKINFO VsCommands2K.OUTLN_STOP_HIDING_ALL VsCommands2K.OUTLN_START_AUTOHIDING VsCommands2K.SHOWCONTEXTMENU
Most of the work is delegated to the Source object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.CodeWindowManager
member.summary: Returnt the CodeWindowManager that created this view filter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.Source
member.summary: Return the Source object encapsulating the text buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.TextTipData
member.summary: Get or set the TextTipData object used for displaying tool tips.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.TextView
member.summary: Return the IVsTextView associated with this filter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.GetWordExtent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan[])
member.summary: Returns the result of Source.GetWordExtent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.GetDataTipText(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan[],System.String@)
member.summary: If Preferences.EnableQuickInfo is true then this method kicks of a parse with the reason BackgroundRequestReason.QuickInfo to find information about the current token. If the parse finds something (returned via the IntellisenseInfo.GetDataTipText) then it is displayed using the TextTipData object. When the asynchronous parse is finished GetFullDataTipText is called to pop up the tip.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.QueryCommandStatus(System.Guid@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Override this method to intercept the IOleCommandTarget::QueryStatus call.
member.returns: Usually returns a combination of OLECMDF flags, for example OLECMDF_ENABLED | OLECMDF_SUPPORTED. Return E_FAIL if want to delegate to the next command target.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.QueryParameterList(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The parameter list of a command is queried by calling Exec with the LOWORD of nCmdexecopt set to OLECMDEXECOPT_SHOWHELP (instead of the more usual OLECMDEXECOPT_DODEFAULT), the HIWORD of nCmdexecopt set to VSCmdOptQueryParameterList, pvaIn set to NULL, and pvaOut pointing to an empty VARIANT ready to receive the result BSTR. This should be done only for commands that are marked with the ALLOWPARAMS flags in the command table.
member.returns: Usually returns 0 if ok, or OLECMDERR_E_NOTSUPPORTED

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.HandlePostExec(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method hooks up HandleSmartIndent and Source.OnCommand.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.ExecCommand(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Override this method to intercept the IOleCommandTarget::Exec call.
member.returns: Usually returns 0 if ok, or OLECMDERR_E_NOTSUPPORTED

members.member: Override this method if you want to support smart indenting. This will only be called if Preferences.Indenting == IndentingStyle.Smart which is only available if you set your language service registry key ShowSmartIndent to 1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.HandleQuickInfo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called to handle the VsCommands2K.QUICKINFO command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.GetFullDataTipText(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.TextSpan,System.String@)
member.summary: This method checks to see if the IVsDebugger is running, and if so, calls it to get additional information about the current token and returns a combined result. You can return an HRESULT here like TipSuccesses2.TIP_S_NODEFAULTTIP.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.CreateTextTipData
member.summary: Creates the TextTipData object and returns it

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.HandleGoto(Microsoft.VisualStudio.VSConstants.VSStd97CmdID,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Handles VsCommands.GotoDefn, VsCommands.GotoDecl and VsCommands.GotoRef by calling OnSyncGoto on the Source object and opening the text editor on the resulting URL, then scrolling to the resulting span.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.GetSelection
member.summary: Returns the current selection, adjusted to become a positive text span

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.ViewFilter.CanReformat
member.summary: This method returns true if the FormatDocument and FormatSelection commands are to be enabled. Default returns false if debugging, otherwise it returns the result for Preferences.EnableFormatSelection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.FSharp.LanguageService.TextTipData
member.summary: This class provides a default implementation of IVsTextTipData for use in the IVsTextTipWindow for displaying tool tips.
